intro: Pneumonanthopsis clavata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in clusters around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pneumonanthopsis clavata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
